text:
Sniper: Assassin's End – A Cinematic Disaster....

Assassin's End is like enduring a slow, painful cinematic lobotomy. The plot is so uninspired and nonsensical that it feels like it was cobbled together by brain-dead interns on a caffeine crash. The acting? A masterclass in wooden performances and awkward line delivery that makes even the most generic B-movies look like Oscar contenders.

From start to finish, the film manages to insult the viewer’s intelligence with every predictable twist, lifeless action scene, and cringeworthy dialogue. It’s the kind of movie that actively angers you while watching – a rare feat of filmmaking incompetence. If you find any joy in this mess, you might as well sign up for a lifetime of peeling potatoes, because critical thinking clearly isn't your strong suit.

Avoid at all costs.
Movies don't come much worse than this... the plot, dialogue, sequences, acting... industrial-strength BS.
Really good movie. Good suspense and action. Very enjoyable. A typical sniper movie. I enjoyed it. People are trying to put too much thought into it. Definitely worth a watch.
Absolutely mediocre. Shame that a fine actor like Tom Berenger would stoop to this level of blandness, but I guess everyone has to make a buck somehow.
Plot was interesting and it tied the series together well. Great action sequences without being boring or overdone. Highly recommend watching it
Great action and nice plot twist

This movie is just your standard assassin flick, offering nothing new or thrilling. It completely fell flat, feeling like a rehash of countless films we've seen before. "Sniper Assassins End" was simply a dull and uninspired take on the genre.

The plot was basic, with an ending that felt like a generic copy-and-paste from any other movie—lacking any real depth. The acting was mediocre at best, leading to a sense of utter boredom. Watching this film was so unengaging that I felt it was easy to just tune out.

I started it hoping for something entertaining, but honestly, it ended up being more of a background distraction while I played on my phone.
Better than the first one. But this movie focuses so much on the framing of the protagonist and the ever-so-typical snitch in the CIA.

Yet another sniper movie. If you have enjoyed the past movies you’ll probably also enjoy this one there’s absolutely nothing memorable here. A lame script and story. One dimensional villains. It has enough to keep your attention and a couple of the sniper scenes are pretty cool but in the end you wish there was less talk and more sniping.
How do I give this movie a negative star?

Фильм слишком затянутый, интрига заканчивается сразу после начала фильма. Сюжет дебильный. Актерская игра простая. Не логическое поведение персонажей. Финал ужасный. Мало экшена. Фильму явно не хватает денег и хорошего сценариста
Absolute pile of shite. Don't bother.
Poor Tom B. Got pulled i to this crap for the money...

They took 90 minutes to tell a story that could of been told in 60. It's dragging and we got a 'professional' assassin that makes mistake after mistake. I needed something easy to watch and that I found. Nothing more.

I've always loved watching the Sniper movies and when they introed the complex father/son relationship we saw some resentment in the earlier movies so it was good to see them together again. We also get to hear a little bit more of the story. Can't wait to see what is next for Brandon Beckett!

Looking into the movie, there are some like good stuff,like best sniper shot scenes
And the story point it actually sucks..
Why they leave like a phase two step!
Ending in the movie..
Sniper Assassin's end(it's really sucks) 
I'm gonna give to a 4.5/10
